questiontext.text:
When a camera lens is defocussed, which of the following statements is true:

{1:MCV:~=The spectrum of spatial frequencies contained within the image becomes narrower.#You got it!~The camera's "point response function" becomes narrower.#Incorrect~The image appears sharper.#Incorrect~Multiplying the Fourier transform of the image by a constant will affect the smoothness of the image.#Incorrect}

When a camera lens is defocussed, which of the following statements is false:

{1:MCV:~Multiplying the Fourier transform of the image by a constant will not affect the smoothness of the image.#Incorrect~=The spectrum of spatial frequencies contained within the image becomes broader.#You got it!~The image appears smoother.#Incorrect~The camera's "point response function" becomes broader.#Incorrect}

When a camera lens is defocussed, which of the following statements is true:

{1:MCV:~The camera's "point response function" becomes narrower.#Incorrect~Multiplying the Fourier transform of the image by a constant will affect the smoothness of the image.#Incorrect~The image appears sharper.#Incorrect~=The spectrum of spatial frequencies contained within the image becomes narrower.#You got it!}

When a camera lens is defocussed, which of the following statements is false:

{1:MCV:~The camera's "point response function" becomes broader.#Incorrect~=The spectrum of spatial frequencies contained within the image becomes broader.#You got it!~The image appears smoother.#Incorrect~Multiplying the Fourier transform of the image by a constant will not affect the smoothness of the image.#Incorrect}

When a camera lens is defocussed, which of the following statements is true:

{1:MCV:~The image appears sharper.#Incorrect~The camera's "point response function" becomes narrower.#Incorrect~Multiplying the Fourier transform of the image by a constant will affect the smoothness of the image.#Incorrect~=The spectrum of spatial frequencies contained within the image becomes narrower.#You got it!}

When a camera lens is defocussed, which of the following statements is false:

{1:MCV:~The camera's "point response function" becomes broader.#Incorrect~=The spectrum of spatial frequencies contained within the image becomes broader.#You got it!~Multiplying the Fourier transform of the image by a constant will not affect the smoothness of the image.#Incorrect~The image appears smoother.#Incorrect}

When a camera lens is defocussed, which of the following statements is true:

{1:MCV:~The image appears sharper.#Incorrect~Multiplying the Fourier transform of the image by a constant will affect the smoothness of the image.#Incorrect~=The spectrum of spatial frequencies contained within the image becomes narrower.#You got it!~The camera's "point response function" becomes narrower.#Incorrect}

When a camera lens is defocussed, which of the following statements is false:

{1:MCV:~The camera's "point response function" becomes broader.#Incorrect~Multiplying the Fourier transform of the image by a constant will not affect the smoothness of the image.#Incorrect~The image appears smoother.#Incorrect~=The spectrum of spatial frequencies contained within the image becomes broader.#You got it!}

When a camera lens is defocussed, which of the following statements is true:

{1:MCV:~The camera's "point response function" becomes narrower.#Incorrect~The image appears sharper.#Incorrect~=The spectrum of spatial frequencies contained within the image becomes narrower.#You got it!~Multiplying the Fourier transform of the image by a constant will affect the smoothness of the image.#Incorrect}

When a camera lens is defocussed, which of the following statements is false:

{1:MCV:~Multiplying the Fourier transform of the image by a constant will not affect the smoothness of the image.#Incorrect~=The spectrum of spatial frequencies contained within the image becomes broader.#You got it!~The camera's "point response function" becomes broader.#Incorrect~The image appears smoother.#Incorrect}
